Definition: description
( database GUID)
An abbreviation term.
The meaning of an abbreviation term.
The entity type which the abbreviation term denotes.
( database GUID)
A provider assigned accession identifier for the cell type set.
Name of the cell type set taxonomy.

example: The top level of cell type definition in the mouse whole brain taxonomy. It is primarily determined by broad brain region and neurotransmitter type. All cells within a subclass belong to the same class. Class provides a broader categorization of cell types.
Definition: Description of the cell type set.
A tag denoting the type or purpose of the cell type set.
The priority or display order of the cell type set among all other sets of the same type.
( database GUID)
A provider assigned accession identifier for the cell type taxon.
Name of the cell type taxon.
The priority or display order of the cell type taxon among all other taxons in the taxonomy.
Description of the cell type taxon (optional).
The aggregated number of cells that defines the cell type taxon.
( database GUID)
The creation date of the cell type taxonomy.
A provider assigned accession identifier for the taxonomy.
Name of the cell type taxonomy.
Description of the cell type taxonomy.
( database GUID)
A provider assigned accession identifier for the cluster which is unique amongs all clusters in cluster set.
Name of the cluster.
The number of observations in the cluster.
( database GUID)
The creation date of the cluster set.
A provider assigned accession identifier for the cluster set.
Name of the cluster set.
Description of the cluster set.
( database GUID)
Name of the color palette.
Description of the color palette.
